snippet: A 66-foot ice tower built to set a world record and to draw visitors to Superior, Wis., collapsed on Tuesday, three months after a backyard sculptor began the $30,000 project.
abstract: Superior Journal; ice sculpture begun by self-taught engineer Roger Hanson in Superior, Wis, in effort to surpass world's tallest ice sculpture record cracks and falls to ground, destroying three months of work; tower, bearing name Lake Superior Ice Project, had reportedly reached 66 feet, surpassing Guinness world record of 53 feet, but its height had not been verified.
lead_paragraph: A 66-foot ice tower built to set a world record and to draw visitors to Superior, Wis., collapsed on Tuesday, three months after a backyard sculptor began the $30,000 project.

headline.main: A Crashing End to a Work of Ice a City Had Warmed Up To
headline.print_headline: A Crashing End to a Work of Ice a City Had Warmed Up To
